sentence.idiomatic: You kind of suck at this, you can't even get past the first level.
Although I'm a ball fan, I play terribly.
It's a dumb question, but which hand should I hold the racket with?
If a person has ever taken advantage of me, I don't let it go.
This isn't his fault. You'd better just let it slide.
I don't want to let such a good opportunity slip away.
After he got rich, he looked down on poor people.
My girlfriend's family thinks I am uncultured, and they look down on me.
Because he is not a local, others often look down on him.
I'm going to throw it over--you have to catch it.
She plays ball so well. I can't return one of her shots.
I just gave them a telephone call, but no one answered.
I've lived here for so many years, I got used to it a long time ago.
Previously, I always went to bed very late. Today I went to bed so early, it's really hard to get used to.
Not eating breakfast is not a good habit to get into.
The way you are holding the writing brush is not right.
He held my hand lightly and said, "Don't worry."
Even when he's sleeping he holds the little box in his hand.
If you hit the ball too hard when you're serving, the ball is likely to go out of bounds.
The ball is right on the line, does that count as out?
That ball went out of bounds, but the referee didn't see it.
Ha ha, I am not too good at badminton. You serve.
OK, give me the birdie... keep your eye on it!
Whoa! Nice smash! I'm a newbie, so how about going easy on me?
All right. Here it comes!
Hey! I may be a beginner, but that's no reason to humiliate me like this. If you were me, you wouldn't have been able to get that one either.
Sorry, it's just a habit. You should hold the racket like this.
All right, all right.
2 to 0.
Oh, it's out!
As if! Did you get a good look?
Uh... oh... it's not out, heh heh.
